Does anyone know how to remove the homepage `/` from a robots.txt file? or more specifically, how to prevent our homepage from showing up in HubSpot search results?
`Disallow: /` is all pages (92% sure)
<@UDHT6N5SM> Can you describe how you found the file that was cached to fix this? (having the same issue and not sure where it's coming from)
`<meta name="HubSpotContentSearchBot" content="noindex">`doesn't seem to work in any scenario

Sorry, I wish I knew. I'm not entirely convinced the issue was cache related. I had the problem in production so I literally duplicated the entire thing as a new module, updated the template, and published it again
if you have a link or anything I can look at I can check it out
definitely something I want to understand

one thing to consider is if you run local development and delete files those files or their code might still be in HubSpot tucked away into a module or still being referenced because a file was deleted
I think in that last scenario HubSpot tries to "help" by linking to the old file
That's so weird! That would be great if you looked at it, it's <https://www.continuant.com/>
everything looks good to me (what is broken on your end)
+ no messages in console
I see the error everywhere? (on Chrome)
maybe in your case it really is cache
trying add ?123 to the end of the url
Thoughts here?
Maybe start a forum post to start gathering info?
Robots.txt files is used to block crawlers such as GoogleBot from crawling and potentially indexing your site and showing in the search engine results pages.
You mention HubSpot search results not sure what you are referring too.
what if you're not using jQuery? there seems to be no solution to this
Hey all, has the new version of the HubSpot CMS for Developers course been launched yet?

How do I get a bunch of contacts by their ID? Does this work? <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts/batch/read>? I get this error Contacts may only be looked up by 'email' as part of a unique property value request.  Property requested: id
I'm confused by the fact that CTAs with "no style" render as images. How am I supposed to style them at a theme or module level? :confused:
Have you looked under the advanced options tab. Give it a custom class then target it either there or in your theme or module.

Hi all, i want to use the search module on my blog index page and based on the search imput, i want to show the results on the same index page. At the moment am allways getting redirected to another page with search results. Is it possible to make this implementation???
